content.description: Shares start with Route 27 but move left onto the rail with hard to see feet. When the rail ends go up!
content.location: Same boulder as Route 27 near the Greenway Dr entrance.

content.description: Nice short problem with sustained moves to easy finish. Start with double undercling near rock in the ground, then reach far to the lefthand jug. Work your way up with technical feet avoiding the right arete.
content.location: A boulder about 200 feet east of the main Gardens area. Just south of and within eyeshot of the Easter island boulder, the route faces north.

content.description: Easy fun climb
content.location: Left face Around the corner from bro Co's / shelob

content.description: Fun problem with overhanging start then up a slab.
content.location:
See

Overview of The Gardens

content.description: Another steep crimpy face, but shorter.
content.location:
See

Overview of The Gardens

content.description: Nice steep crimpy face.
content.location:
See

Overview of The Gardens

content.description: This climbs a less than vertical dihedral via friction and liebacking.
content.location:
Obvious right-facing corner just right of

Route 6

.

content.description:
Same boulder as Routes 4 & 5, but on the east side.

Knobs up a steep face.
content.location:
See

Overview of The Gardens

content.description: Steeper and blanker than the other routes, with a long reach for a crimper, and some delicate footwork.
content.location:
See

Overview of The Gardens

content.description: Sit start matched on a sidepull and reach up to the big ledge. Mantle on the big ledge, then top out straight above, avoiding the easy holds out to the right. Some of the holds to the right felt loose and should probably be avoided anyway.
content.location: This is in between Route 4 and Route 5, and just right of Garden Arete.

content.description: A fun outing up the left arete of a huge flake.
content.location:
Just right of the obvious crack that is

Route 4.1

.

content.description: A short and sometimes awkward crack that ends atop the large flake.
content.location:
Obvious crack immediately right of

Route 4

.

content.description: Nice long and easy face on good holds.
content.location:
See

Overview of The Gardens

content.description: Climb good flakes starting at chest level.
content.location:
Located on the same boulder of

Route 3

on the left.

content.description:
Slightly overhanging on good flakes - some of which may be loose.

Descent

Go left along the ridge then down the back side of the boulder.
content.location:
See

Overview of The Gardens

content.description: Short but fun. Stand start using right side pull and small left crimp, left hand up then right hand on sharp edge, left hand to slopey top then good holds for top out.
content.location: Same boulder as Route 25 near the back of The Gardens

content.description: Sit start under the overhang, move up and right to the top.
content.location: The big boulder with route 12 on it, keep walking past it and the boulder will be a 20 or 30 yds past it and a bit to the left.

content.description: Start on a left undercling and right edge then work up the face.
content.location: Stay on the face on the left of the arette.

content.description: Stand start and work up the side pull into a small crack then to a few crimps
content.location: Around the backside from the road. Tallest problem on the boulder. Don't touch the arette from problem 12.

content.description: Climb features to the right side of face.
content.location: To the right of #21

content.description: Left side of face
content.location: From area for #15 - #20 walk further back to the next large rock area

content.description: Climb crack on right face, to the right of #18 - 19.
content.location: to the right of #18 - 19.

content.description: Steep face using good holds, and an undercling, with a high step at the end.
content.location: When close to Route 2 if you look left you'll see the rectangular boulder, just across the clearing.

content.description: A nice face/arete with positive features throughout.
content.location:
Located on the face just right of

Route 2.1

.

content.description: This is the obvious slanting break/crack that offers a few good hand jams up high.
content.location:
Just right of

Route 2

.

content.description:
A face up the south side with good holds.

Descent

At the top go right along the ridge and down the south side to the right of the route.
content.location:
See

Overview of The Gardens

content.description: Climb face to the right of offwidth up a mix of jugs and slab.
content.location: Face to the right of route 18 / offwidth

content.description: Offwidth chimney with lots of body jams. Short, but fun
content.location: Offwidth / chimny to the right of route 17

content.description: Starting to the left of the crack ( #17 / Easter Island ), climb the arete up the right side to a second boulder for a slightly exposed top out. Fun moves, w a cool layback start
content.location: Right side of the arete, around corner from #16 and to the right of #17 / Easter Island

content.description: Up the slab then over the two stacked upper boulders on good holds.
content.location: North of Route 14 Boulder. South Face of the Boulder - right-hand route.

content.description: Up a short slab then the overlap and knobby face above.
content.location: North of Route 14 Boulder. South face - left hand problem.

content.description:
A very fine problem up a smooth face followed by flat holds to finish. Try to ignore the bigger holds on the left, but use just the flat holds.

I'm calling it Route 14 until someone claims an FA with a name.
content.location: A boulder about 200 feet east of the main Gardens area. Route faces north.

content.description: My favorite problem here. Up the steep face on good holds.
content.location:
On the north side of the clump of boulders. See

Overview of The Gardens

content.description: Climb the next, taller arete to the right of Route 12. You can sit start at the chalked left-facing undercling down low and move up then right, or start all the way right and move straight up the arete, climbing through the nefarious branches of the neighboring juniper tree (and probably +2 grades for that ;) )
content.protection: Boulder pad, if one were so inclined.
content.location: Next arete right of the Route 12 arete. Did I mention its near an arete?

content.description: Steeply up the arete on though-provoking holds.
content.protection: Pad and spotter. Less than perfect landing.
content.location:
See

Overview of The Gardens

content.description: More knobs with trick feet to start.
content.location:
See

Overview of The Gardens

content.description: Sit down start just to the right of "Route 10". Start with low hands and thrust to great pinch with left hand, then use other features on right and finish top out.
content.location: On North East edge of boulder with "Route 10" on it.

content.description: Sit down start on crimps to much better holds above.
content.location:
See

Overview of The Gardens

content.description:
Easy face suitable for beginners or kids.

vimeo.com/100155585

vimeo.com/100217737
content.protection: Spotter and pad, there's a little uneven landing with a small boulder.
content.location:
It's the first boulder you encounter if you go right at the tree, also see

Overview of The Gardens

content.description:
A teach told me one time that there was another middle school mascot drawn in the bathroom. The one with a nice spray painted male body part on it aka the middle school mascot.

Start on a the left hand rail with a nice right hand edge. Work left up the rail and use the right small crack to stay on. Continue straight up and over.

Don't use right boulder, staying on the overhung rock.
content.location: Near the beginning of the boulders. If walking through the greenway gate head straight back and the boulder will be on your left.

climbs.name: I Told You 4 Times I Didn't Want Salmon (Route 27)

content.description: Sit start on an under cling and side pull. Move hands straight up on some small edges and meet a nice little sloper before topping out!
content.location: Once you enter the gate from Myrtle head straight right then left on the trail (or straight back from Greeenway Dr.). You'll see the boulder on your left a few yds on the trail.

content.description:
Start by standing on a thin buried flake, a pinch and a sidepull lead to a good sidepull, then the holds get better.

Try not to step right onto the ledge to keep it pure.

A good thin technical exercise.
content.location: In between Routes 4 and 5 on the map.

content.description: Easy highball warm up on way to gardens. There are many easy routes on all sides, with a beautiful but more difficult undercling start on the southeast side.
content.location: The tallest boulder just east of Easter island, these boulders are about 200 feet east of the main gardens.

content.description: Fun easy traverse
content.location: Backside of first boulder group by right side entrance.

content.description: Fun traverse by the right entrance. Mostly slab feet with some decent hands.
content.location: From right entrance, 1 street down from mp directions, walk to first group of rocks. Moving to the left, you should see the line. Look for the step up rock.

content.description: Starting on the left side of face, start at under clings w slabby feet, moving up into the crack. Traverse right into shelobs lair and top out using the vertical crack on the right ( shelobs top)
content.location: Boulder face w Lots of graffiti ( entire bottom portion) across from boulder area w #15-20 and Easter Island. Start on left side.

content.description:
Fun climb w some exposure.

Shares start with Bro Co's Lair. Starting on the left side of shelobs boulder. Move up right face of arete and on to the above, slight bulge, boulder. Staying on right face is proper line, can move onto left face to drop a grade
content.location: Left side of face with Bro Co's Lair and shelobs lair

content.description: A fun problem which involves jams and a squirmy finish, unique for the area.
content.location: Facing Route 16, around to the right, the obvious crack on the east face.
